name: Total number of Pods
description: This PromQL query measures the total number of Pods currently running in the Kubernetes cluster.
question: What is the total number of Pods running?

name: Pod Distribution by AZ
description: The PromQL query measures the distribution of pods across different availability zones (AZ) in the Kubernetes cluster.
question: How many pods are running in each availability zone?

name: Pod Distribution by AZ
description: The PromQL query measures the distribution of pods across different availability zones (AZ) in the Kubernetes cluster.
question: Which availability zone has the highest number of pods?

name: Pod Distribution by AZ
description: The PromQL query measures the distribution of pods across different availability zones (AZ) in the Kubernetes cluster.
question: Is the pod distribution evenly spread across all availability zones?

name: Pod Distribution by Namespaces
description: The PromQL query measures the distribution of pods across different namespaces.

question: Which namespace has the highest number of pods?

name: Pod Distribution by Namespaces
description: The PromQL query measures the distribution of pods across different namespaces.

name: Pod Distribution by Node
description: The PromQL query measures the distribution of pods across different nodes in the Kubernetes cluster.
question: How many pods are running on each node?

name: Pod Distribution by Instance Type
description: The PromQL query measures the distribution of pods based on the type of instance they are running on.

name: Pod Distribution by Phase
description: The PromQL query measures the distribution of pods based on their current phase (e.g., Running, Pending, Succeeded, Failed) within a Kubernetes cluster.
question: How many pods are currently in the Running phase?
